intro: Chabertia benearnensis, commonly known as the Benearn's chabertia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
